section.title: The Skeleton Info Toolbox
section.para: When the Skeleton Info toolbox, shown in , is active, clicking the mouse on a &skel; on the Canvas displays information about &elems;, &nodes;, and &sgmts; in the Toolbox. Whether the Toolbox displays &elem;, &node;, or &sgmt;, information is governed by the setting of the Mode Selector buttons at the top of the Toolbox. In all three modes, the position of the mouse click, in physical coordinates is printed below the Mode Selector.

caption.para: The Skeleton Info Toolbox and the Canvas, while querying an &elem;. The window has been resized to show the entire Toolbox, which would otherwise need to be scrolled to be seen.

section.para: In all three modes, the queried &skel; component is highlighted in the Canvas. The Clear button at the bottom of the Toolbox erases the highlighting and clears the data listing. The Prev and Next buttons on either side cycle through the previously selected objects (changing the Toolbox mode, if necessary).

simplesect.title: Element Mode
simplesect.para:
In Element mode, the &elem; being queried is highlighted with a blue perimeter,
The color and size of the markings used to highlight the queried &elems;, &nodes;, and &sgmts; may be changed by editing the display &layer;. This &layer; is predefined and always displays the topmost &skel;. It will be necessary to enable List All Layers in the Settings menu in order to edit the &layer;.
as shown in the figure, and the following data is displayed in the Toolbox:
The &elem;'s index. This is just an integer used to identify the &elem;. All of the &elems; in a &skel; have a unique index. When a &skel; is modifed, the indices of all &elems; may be changed.
The &elem;'s type, indicating its topology.
A list of the &elem;'s &nodes;. &nodes; are listed in counterclockwise order with an arbitrary starting point. Each &node;'s index, position (in physical coordinates), and interior angle (in degrees) are listed.
Clicking on a &node; in the list will highlight it with an pink dot on the Canvas. Double-clicking on a &node; in the list will switch the Toolbox into Node Mode and display information for the chosen &node;.
A list of the &elem;'s &sgmts;, including the &sgmt;'s index, the indices of the &nodes; at its endpoints, and its length (in physical units).
Clicking on a &sgmt; in the list will highlight it with a thick pink line on the Canvas. Double-clicking on a &sgmt; in the list will switch the Toolbox into Segment Mode and display information for the chosen &sgmt;.
The area of the &elem;, in physical units.
The dominant pixel of the &elem;. This is a list of the pixel groups to which the pixels comprising most of the &elem; belong.
The &elem;'s homogeneity.
The &elem;'s shape energy.
The &elem; groups to which the &elem; belongs.
The &material; assigned to the &elem;. This is the &material; that will be used for any &mesh; elements that are created from this &skel;. It is the same as the &material; assiged to the &elem;'s dominant pixel, unless that choice has been overridden by assigning a &material; to an &elemgroup; containing the &elem;.

simplesect.title: Node Mode
simplesect.para:
In Node Mode, the &node; being queried is highlighted in the Canvas with a blue dot. The following information is displayed in the Toolbox:
The &node;'s index. Like the &elem; index, this is just an integer used to identify the &node;. When a &skel; is modified, &nodes; may get new indices.
The position of the &node;, in physical units.
The mobility of the &node;. &nodes; that are pinned are marked as such. &nodes; that are constrained to lie on the boundaries of the µ are marked as x only or y only if they can move in the x or y directions, and as fixed if they cannot move at all. &nodes; with none of these constraints are marked free.
A list of the &elems; which surround the &node;, in no particular order. The index of each &elem; is given.
Clicking on an &elem; in the list highlights that &elem;'s perimeter in pink in the Canvas. Double-clicking will switch the Toolbox to Element Mode and display the information for the chosen &elem;.
The &node; groups to which the &node; belongs.
The point boundaries of which the &node; is a component.

simplesect.title: Segment Mode
simplesect.para:
In Segment Mode, the &sgmt; being queried is highlighted in the Canvas with a blue line. The following information is displayed in the Toolbox:
The index of the &sgmt;. Like the &node; and &elem; indices, this is just an integer identifier. When a &skel; is modified, &sgmt; indices may change.
The &nodes; at the ends of the &sgmt;. The index and position (in physical coordinates) of each &node; is listed.
Clicking on a &node; in the list highlights it with a pink dot in the Canvas. Double-clicking switches the Toolbox to Node Mode and displays the information for the chosen &node;.
The &elems; to which the &sgmt; belongs. The index of each &elem; is given.
Clicking on an &elem; in the list highlights that &elem;'s perimeter in pink in the Canvas. Double-clicking will switch the Toolbox to Element Mode and display the information for the chosen
The length of the &sgmt; in physical units.
Any &sgmt; groups to which the &sgmt; belongs.
Any edge boundaries of which the &sgmt; is a component.
